title: Traditional construction techniques to the rescue of Simhachalam Temple
content: Ancient and steeped in legends, Varaha Lakshmi Narasimha Swamy temple atop Simhachalam remains an architectural wonder of few parallels, but time has taken a toll on this magnificent edifice, with many places on its roof developing leaks. As modern techniques fail to arrest the deterioration, temple management turns to age-old construction practices

title: Skyfall in Ahmedabad
content: On June 12, an Air India aircraft carrying 242 passengers and crew members crashed into the B.J. Medical College in Meghani Nagar, just moments after take-off in Ahmedabad. The Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner burst into flames, killing 241 people aboard and several others in the medical college dining mess and its premises. Jagriti Chandra and Abhinay Deshpande report on one of the worst aviation disasters in recent history

title: Air India Ahmedabad plane crash: What are black boxes? How do they work?

content: Barcelona are set to sign Joan García after exercising the Espanyol goalkeeper's €25 million ($28.9 million) release clause, a source has confirmed to ESPN.

title: Flight Attendant, Influencer, Family's Heartbeat: 26-Year-Old Who Died In Crash
content: She was the heartbeat of her house and very popular on social media too. The 26-year-old was a flight attendant with Air India and her life, which had already taken off and was cruising at a high altitude, was about to soar even higher.

title: 2 Plane Crash Survivors, Seated In 11A, Walked Away Alive Nearly 3 Decades Apart
content: Two plane crash survivors, nearly three decades apart, shared the same seat: 11A. The first crash happened in Thailand in 1998, the other in India in 2025, and both survivors walked away from near-certain death.

title: Israel Attacks Iran News LIVE: Three Iran Nuclear Scientists Killed In New Israel Attack
content: Israel Attacks Iran Live Updates: A new explosion was heard at a key uranium enrichment site in central Iran on Friday morning, hours after Israel launched unprecedented air strikes against the Islamic Republic's nuclear programme.

title: Congress, BJP Conspiring To Defame KCR Over Irrigation Project: KTR
content: Telangana's BRS working president KT Rama Rao alleged that the Congress and BJP have conspired to defame former chief minister K Chandrasekhar Rao over the Kaleswaram lift irrigation project.

content: Ahmedabad Air India Plane Crash Live Updates: At least 274 people were killed in one of India's deadliest plane crashes involving a London-bound Air India flight in Ahmedabad earlier this week.

title: Heatwave Breaks June Temperature Record In 2 Northeast Cities
content: The northeast region is witnessing a severe heatwave, with the cities of Itanagar and Dibrugarh breaking their June temperature records on Thursday.

title: Andhra Journalist Arrested For Defamatory Remark Made On Show Gets Bail
content: A journalist from Andhra Pradesh has been granted bail by the Supreme Court after being arrested for a derogatory comment made by a panellist on his show.

title: Sonam Stayed Here Secretly After Raja's Murder, Had A Rental Agreement Too

title: Charred Vehicles, Lost Caretakers: NGO Aids Shock-Stricken Animals After Plane Crash

title: What Spike In Pizza Orders Near Pentagon Indicates About Global Crises
content: Most of these fast-food chains that reported unusually high activity and sales were located near the Pentagon, the US military headquarters.

title: Op Sindoor A testament Of Air Force's Unparalleled Prowess: Air Chief
content: Operation Sindoor demonstrated IAF's capability to deliver swift, precise and decisive blows to the enemy, said IAF Chief, Air Chief Marshal AP Singh.

title: "We Felt The Land Shake, We Are Scared": Indian Students In Iran Seek Evacuation
content: The Jammu and Kashmir Students Association had written to Minister Dr S Jaishankar, requesting for assistance. Jammu and Kashmir Students Association national convenor said that students have reported hearing air raid sirens and feeling tremors.

title: "Mom Said She'll Be Back": Cabin Crew's Daughter, Unaware Of Crash, Awaits
content: Aparna's young daughter, unaware of the full extent of the tragedy, clings to the last words of her mother: "Mom said she'll be back."

title: 'NRI City' Couple Cancelled June 6 Plan, Booked Doomed June 12 London Flight
content: Located approximately 76 km from Ahmedabad, Anand is known as Gujarat's 'NRI City'. Of the 274 people who died in the Ahmedabad plane crash on Thursday, 33 from Anand were on board the doomed Flight AI171 en route to London Gatwick.

title: Watch: Iranian Drones Intercepted Mid-Air Over Sea By Israeli Navy
content: Hours after Israel killed top Iranian military officers in airstrikes targeting the country's military and nuclear installations, the Islamic Republic retaliated, launching ballistic missiles towards Tel Aviv and Jerusalem.

title: Red Alert In 5 Kerala Districts, Heavy To Extremely Heavy Rainfall Likely
content: An orange alert has been sounded for Palakkad, Thrissur, Ernakulam, Idukki, Kottayam, and Pathanamthitta, while Alappuzha, Kollam, and Thiruvananthapuram remain under a yellow alert.

title: Vijay Rupani Cancelled London Ticket Twice, June 12 Was Not His 1st Choice
content: Former Gujarat Chief Minister, Vijay Rupani, was among the 242 people on board the doomed Air India 787-8 Dreamliner, which crashed in Ahmedabad on June 12. Only one survived, and 241 people died, including the former Chief Minister.

title: Fire for fire: 'Tehran will burn', warns Israel after missile barrage from Iran
content: Tensions escalate as Israel warns Iran that Tehran will "burn" if missile attacks on Jerusalem persist, following casualties and injuries. Iran retaliated with a barrage of missiles and drones, triggering sirens and explosions across Israeli cities. Netanyahu vowed to neutralize the Iranian threat, raising fears of a full-scale war despite international calls for restraint.

title: Publish Boeing report immediately: Whistleblower's lawyer to US FAA
content: Following the Air India crash involving a Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner in Ahmedabad, attorneys for Boeing whistleblower Sam Salehpour are urging the FAA to release its findings on alleged structural defects in Boeing's 787 aircraft. Salehpour had previously raised concerns about the integrity of Boeing's 787 and 777 planes, prompting an FAA investigation.

title: Watch: Iran breaches Iron Dome, strikes Israel's 'Pentagon' in Tel Aviv
content: In a significant escalation of the ongoing conflict, Iran launched a retaliatory strike targeting Israel's Kirya compound in Tel Aviv, a critical military site housing the IDF's general staff and defence ministry. Reports indicate that a barrage of Iranian missiles struck deep into Israel's defence infrastructure, causing significant damage.

title: Onstage drama: Kamal Haasan loses cool after man gifts him a sword - video
content: Actor Kamal Haasan faced an awkward moment at a party meeting in Chennai. A man gifted him a sword on stage, leading to a brief commotion. Haasan appeared visibly displeased and asked the man to put the sword down. Meanwhile, Haasan is embroiled in a controversy in Karnataka. The Karnataka High Court addressed his remarks about the Kannada language. He claimed Kannada originated from Tamil, sparking outrage.

title: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon to managers: 'Fire those who …'
content: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon has advised managers to prioritize a positive workplace culture by firing employees and even customers who exhibit toxic behavior. Dimon emphasized that removing disruptive individuals, regardless of their contributions, is crucial for fostering a respectful and effective environment. He also mentioned his retirement is still several years away.

title: Air India crash: One more body recovered from AI-171 wreckage
content: The Air India AI-171 crash in Ahmedabad has claimed over 270 lives, marking India's worst aviation disaster. The Dreamliner, en route to London, crashed shortly after takeoff, hitting a medical college campus. Recovery efforts continue, with DNA matching underway to identify victims.

title: IND vs ENG: Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy launch postponed; out of respect for crash victims
content: The launch of the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy, intended to replace the Pataudi Trophy for India-England Test series in England, has been postponed. This decision follows the devastating plane crash in Ahmedabad, which claimed over 275 lives. The ECB and BCCI jointly decided to defer the ceremony out of respect for the victims.

title: Layoffs at Google? Company tells these employees to choose: three days to...
content: Google is intensifying its return-to-office mandate, compelling remote employees within 50 miles of offices to adopt a three-day on-site work week or risk job termination. This policy expansion coincides with voluntary buyout programs for select US-based teams, excluding divisions like DeepMind and YouTube. Executives emphasize in-person collaboration as crucial for innovation and employee engagement.

title: ‘Standing silent as Israel annihilates a nation’: Congress on India's UN Gaza vote
content: The Congress party criticises the government's abstention from the UNGA vote on a Gaza ceasefire. Mallikarjun Kharge and other leaders call it a departure from India's foreign policy. Priyanka Gandhi Vadra deems the abstention shameful. Pawan Khera accuses the government of moral cowardice. K C Venugopal questions the shift in India's stance.

title: Microsoft's top executive to engineers: If you're working with AI-generated code...
content: Microsoft executives emphasize the enduring importance of coding skills in the age of AI. Aparna Chennapragada argues that logical and critical thinking, inherent in coding, are crucial for collaborating with AI systems. Satya Nadella highlights the need for computational thinking and structured instruction, envisioning a future where everyone is a software architect.

title: 'Not just a building': BJP protests attacks on Tagore's ancestral home in Bangladesh
content: The Bharatiya Janata Party's Sadar Urban Committee organized a protest rally in Agartala, condemning violence against minorities in Bangladesh and the reported attack on Rabindranath Tagore's ancestral home. Senior BJP leaders addressed the crowd, criticizing the alleged atrocities and the silence of political opponents.

title: Air India plane crash: 'This one felt different', coffin maker after order for 100 units
content: Nilesh Vaghela, an Ahmedabad coffin maker, provided a crucial service following the devastating AI-171 crash that claimed 274 lives. Arriving at the civil hospital with 20 coffins, Nilesh, who typically makes seven coffins daily, received an urgent order for 100.

title: Israel attacks Gaza: 27 killed overnight - 16 in strikes, 11 in civilian shootings
content: Israeli airstrikes in Gaza resulted in the death of sixteen Palestinians. Eleven more Palestinians died near food distribution centers. Witnesses reported Israeli forces fired on civilians. The military claims it fired warning shots. Aid distribution faces challenges. The conflict began on October 7, 2023. It has caused numerous casualties. Recent Israeli strikes on Iran have escalated regional tensions.

title: Cabin crew deaths blur Kuki-Meitei divide; ‘angels of the sky unite 2 communities'
content: Manipur mourns the tragic loss of two cabin crew members, a Kuki and a Meitei, in the Ahmedabad Air India plane crash. This shared grief has momentarily united the communities, transcending ethnic divisions. Amidst the sorrow, there's an outpouring of support and calls for peace, highlighting the preciousness of human life and the need for coexistence.

title: Graduation celebration turns to grief: Daughter waits alone in UK as family never arrives
content: A family from Vasad, Anand, faced unimaginable tragedy as three members died in the Flight AI171 crash shortly after takeoff from Ahmedabad. Rajnikant Patel, his wife Divya, and sister-in-law Hemangini were en route to London for Dhvani Patel's MBA graduation.

title: Cyprus, Canada and Croatia: PM Modi's first foreign visit since Op Sindoor
content: Narendra Modi will visit Cyprus, Canada, and Croatia. The Prime Minister will first visit Cyprus to meet President Nikos Christodoulides. He will then attend the G-7 Summit in Canada. Discussions will include energy security and AI. Finally, Modi will visit Croatia for talks with Prime Minister Andrej Plenkovic and President Zoran Milanovic.

title: Air India crash: High-level panel to submit report in 3 months; AAIB decoding black box
content: Union Civil Aviation Minister Ram Mohan Naidu announced a three-month deadline for the Air India Flight 171 crash investigation in Ahmedabad. The recovery of the black box is expected to provide crucial insights into the cause of the accident. The flight, bound for London Gatwick, crashed shortly after takeoff, resulting in numerous fatalities, with only one survivor.

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: Air India, AI Express drop flight number '171' – report
content: Following the tragic crash of Air India flight 'AI 171' from Ahmedabad to London Gatwick, which claimed 241 lives, both Air India and Air India Express have decided to discontinue using the flight number. The Ahmedabad-London Gatwick service will now operate under 'AI 159'.

title: 'Striking dozens of Iran missile launchers,' says Israel; two Iranian generals killed
content: Tensions soar as Israel targets Iranian missile sites after Tehran's retaliatory strikes. Two Iranian generals are dead. Israel hit targets near Tehran. Rockets struck residential areas in Israel, causing casualties. The conflict escalates with strikes deep inside Iran. Iran retaliated with missile barrages at Tel Aviv and Jerusalem. International calls for calm are growing louder.

title: Iran appoints Amir Hatami as army chief after Israel kills top generals
content: Following Israeli strikes that killed top commanders, Iran's Supreme Leader Khamenei appointed Amir Hatami as the new Army Chief. This reshuffle includes naming Mohammad Pakpour as IRGC Commander and Ali Shadmani as Commander of the Khatam al-Anbiya Central Headquarters. These changes come after Operation Rising Lion, which significantly impacted Iran's military leadership, prompting retaliatory strikes and heightened regional tensions.

title: Temperatures fall in Delhi but why does it still feel like 50.3°C?
content: Delhi experienced a drop in maximum temperature by up to 6.1 degrees Celsius on Friday, offering slight respite from the intense heat, though high humidity persisted. A change in weather patterns, including a trough line and a western disturbance, brought moisture and thunder activity to northwest India.

title: Happy Father’s Day 2025: Wishes, messages, quotes, images, Facebook & WhatsApp Status
content: Father's Day on June 15, 2025, offers a chance to celebrate dads, whose love is often shown through actions rather than words. The article suggests ditching traditional gifts for heartfelt expressions. It provides a range of messages, from humorous one-liners to sincere sentiments, alongside famous quotes and social media status ideas.

title: Last meal becomes final goodbye: 3 BJMC friends die in plane crash
content: A tragic airplane crash in Ahmedabad claimed the lives of several BJ Medical College students, including first-year students Aryan Rajput and Manav Bhadoo, along with second-year student Jay Prakash Chaudhary, who were having lunch together. Rakesh Diyora, another second-year student, also perished in the disaster while preparing for his upcoming exams, leaving his family in grief.

title: Israel apologises to Indians over wrong map
content: The Israeli Defence Forces (IDF) issued an apology on X to Indians for sharing a post featuring an inaccurate map of India, which omitted Jammu & Kashmir, Ladakh, and misrepresented Arunachal Pradesh. This occurred amidst heightened tensions as Iran launched missile strikes against Israel in retaliation for Operation "Rising Lion," which targeted Iranian nuclear facilities and military commanders.

title: Watch: Kids caught unscrewing Patna bridge - video goes viral
content: A disturbing video circulating online depicts children dismantling a bridge in Patna, Bihar, by removing nuts and bolts, creating a significant safety risk. This incident has sparked concerns about the quality of construction materials used in Bihar's infrastructure. The incident follows a series of bridge collapses in the state last year, highlighting potential issues with construction practices and oversight.

title: No entry for Ola, Uber cab services in Goa
content: Goa's Chief Minister Pramod Sawant, bowing to pressure from coastal MLAs, has assured that cab aggregators like Ola and Uber will not be permitted in the state. This decision comes despite the notification of draft aggregator guidelines.

title: UP woman strangled, stuffed in suitcase: Husband knew of murder plot
content: Ghaziabad police arrested Sagar, his mother, and sister for the murder of Kavita, whose body was found in a suitcase. Sagar initially feigned ignorance, claiming his wife left after a dispute. However, call records revealed his involvement in the conspiracy with his father and brothers, who had already been arrested for the crime.

title: 3 dead, 1 critical after Bikaner men drugged, looted by fake occultists
content: In Khajuwala, Bikaner, a gang posing as occult practitioners allegedly drugged four men with sedatives, leading to three deaths and one hospitalization. The victims were lured with promises of doubled money through black magic, but were instead robbed of cash and valuables estimated at Rs 45–50 lakh. Police are investigating the possibility of internal betrayal among the victims.

title: ‘Talks meaningless’: Iran blames US for backing Israel
content: Iran has declared nuclear talks with the US "meaningless" following Israel's military strike, accusing Washington of complicity, a claim the US denies. Despite the tensions, the US urges Iran to resume negotiations, while US President Trump claims his ultimatum set the stage for the strikes. The scheduled nuclear talks in Muscat are now uncertain.

title: ‘Plane debris landed on my car’: Man takes U-turn to escape death by seconds
content: In Ahmedabad, a developer named Rashmi Chauhan narrowly avoided a plane crash while driving on his usual route. A sudden explosion occurred as an Air India plane crashed just meters ahead of his SUV. Reacting instantly, Chauhan made a U-turn, escaping the debris and potential fatal consequences, considering himself incredibly fortunate.

title: 'When will PM Modi speak up?' Congress lists 13 Trump claims on India-Pak ceasefire
content: Congress has criticised Prime Minister Modi's silence on Donald Trump's repeated claims of brokering a ceasefire between India and Pakistan. Jairam Ramesh highlighted Trump's remarks and questioned whether India's foreign policy was being compromised. He urged Modi to address growing diplomatic challenges, citing recent US-Pakistan engagements and calling for an all-party meeting to discuss the situation.

title: Plane crash: Hand payouts to kin of medical college victims too, says IMA to Tatas
content: The Indian Medical Association's Gujarat chapter has appealed to Tata Sons, urging them to extend compensation to medical students affected by the Air India flight crash, similar to what was announced for passengers. The association emphasizes the students' role as future healthcare providers, advocating for their families to receive comparable care and support in light of the tragedy.

title: NEET UG 2025 topper: Mahesh Kumar from Rajasthan tops with 99.99 percentile,
content: The National Testing Agency (NTA) declared the NEET UG 2025 results today, June 14, with Mahesh Kumar from Rajasthan securing the top rank. Over 22 lakh candidates appeared for the exam, out of which 12,36,531 qualified. Notably, female candidates outnumbered males in qualifying. Qualified candidates are now advised to download their scorecards and monitor counselling updates for further admission processes.

title: 'Any country that attempts to defend Israel will ...': Iran issues warning
content: Tensions escalate in the Middle East. Iran warns nations against defending Israel. This follows Israeli strikes, called Operation Rising Lion, targeting Iranian infrastructure. Iran retaliated with missile attacks on Israeli cities, including Tel Aviv. Ayatollah Ali Khamenei condemned the Israeli assault. He promised consequences and assured Iran's military readiness. The conflict raises concerns about regional stability.

title: Ladakh glacier losing ice rapidly: ‘Milestone study’ led by IIT scientist
content: A recent study reveals that the Drang Drung Glacier in Ladakh, the largest in the Zanskar range, is receding at an average rate of 1 meter per year between 2021 and 2023. Led by IIT Indore, the research highlights the formation of a growing proglacial lake due to the glacier's retreat

title: MCC introduces boundary rule change: What is it and how does it affect the sport?
content: In October 2026, the ICC and MCC will introduce a new catching rule in cricket, disallowing 'bunny-hop' catches where fielders jump from outside the boundary to touch the ball. Fielders can still push the ball from within the boundary, step out, and dive back in to complete a catch.

title: Iran launches fresh wave of attack at Israel; 3rd retaliation in 24 hours
content: Tensions escalate as Iran launches a new wave of attacks on Israel, dubbed "Honest Promise 3," following Israeli strikes on Iranian nuclear and military facilities. Supreme Leader Khamenei vowed retaliation, stating, "We will not permit them to evade consequences." This follows Israel's "greatest military operations in history" inside Iran, targeting key sites and personnel.

title: Plane crash: 'Was there any cyber attack by enemy country?' asks Sanjay Raut
content: Following the tragic crash of Air India Flight AI-171 in Ahmedabad, a Shiv Sena (UBT) leader has raised concerns about potential sabotage and lapses in security and maintenance. Questioning the choice of Ahmedabad and past opposition to the Boeing deal, he called for a thorough investigation.

title: Eknath Shinde encounters bad weather on way to Dare village, takes boat ride home
content: Amidst heavy rainfall warnings in Satara's Mahabaleshwar, Deputy CM Eknath Shinde took a boat ride to reach his Dare village on Friday. Delayed by road from Pune, Shinde opted for a quicker route via Koyna dam backwaters. Despite the rain, he crossed the river by motorboat, followed by a short trek to his village.

title: South Africa will achieve huge milestone if they chase down the 282-run target vs Australia
content: South Africa is on the verge of a historic win against Australia in the World Test Championship final at Lord's. Aiden Markram's unbeaten century and Temba Bavuma's resilient half-century have put them in a strong position, needing just 69 runs to chase down 282.

title: Mya Lesnar, daughter to WWE legend Brock Lesnar, wins national title in shot put
content: Mya Lesnar secured a national championship in the women's shot put finals at the NCAA Outdoor Track and Field Championships on friday . on first attempt, mya recorded a mark of 19.01 meters (62 feet, 4 12 inches) and would stay in the lead the entire competition . the mark finished as much as five inches and a quarter ahead of the next best competitor .

content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . thursday's first day first Show News is your download of the top 5 technology stories of the day . health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health .

title: The Paul Maurice Effect: How the Panthers coach helped create a monster
content: nosek's fourth-line forward flips a puck over the glass with 1:42 remaining in extra time . he could only watch helplessly from there as Leon Draisaitl scores the game winner . coach Paul Maurice says the feeling wouldn't linger .

title: 2026 recruiting class rankings: Rutgers part of Big Ten surge
content: the Big Ten is flexing its muscles on the recruiting trail with 10 teams ranked among the top 25 classes . americans still sit at no. 1 while Ohio State pushes to no. 2 after a pair of ESPN 300 additions: in-state RB Favour Akih and DE Khary Wilder .

title: What Carlisle learned in Dallas to help him coach Tyrese Haliburton
content: coach Rick Carlisle wanted to double-check whether Pascal Siakam was fouled . if the review was successful, the Pacers would have possession of the ball . "Get the ball in Tyrese's hands," coach says .

title: Madrid sign Argentina wonderkid Mastantuono
content: real madrid have signed river plate's Franco Mastantuono . the 17-year-old is with river in the united states for the club world cup . he will join the laLiga club in august .

title: Sun Belt Conference preview: James Madison looks to close deal this time
content: Coastal Carolina has two in the past five . Georgia Southern is coming off its best season in four years . nearly everyone in the Sun Belt has reached solid to great heights of late . if you have to lose every game, that's an awfully impressive sign of parity and general conference health .

title: Pride of the Yankees: Three days with Aaron Judge on the road to immortality
content: it's been a year of dramatic change for their family, some public, some private . Aaron and his wife, Samantha, don't have a nanny or a night nurse . "naps are tough," he said with a laugh .

title: Shubhanshu Shukla's Ax-04 mission: Leak issue resolved; June 19 new launch date
content: axiom space is now targeting June 19, 2025 for the launch of the mission . the launch was deferred to June 8 following the detection of an issue in the electrical harness of the Crew Dragon module . it was then postponed by a day to June 9 — which was not publicly announced .

title: 2025 NBA Finals: The Thunder bounce back in Game 4 to tie the series
content: the no. 1-seeded Oklahoma City Thunder have almost gone down 3-1 twice in these playoffs . the first time was game 4 of the Western Conference semifinals, when the Thunder trailed by eight points on the road in Denver . it's hard to figure out exactly how the Thunder survived .

to ‘reclaim rights’ of people

title: Storylines, top players and predictions
content: college baseball analyst Riggins joins "the Paul Finebaum Show" to discuss the top two remaining seeds going head-to-head in their MCWS opener . this year's tournament brings a mix of competition, featuring teams from six conferences and one independent .
